Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Wishful \Wish"ful\, a. [Cf. {Wistful}.] 1. Having desire, or ardent desire; longing. [1913 Webster]
2. Showing desire; as, wishful eyes. [1913 Webster]
From Scotland am I stolen, even of pure love To greet mine own land with my wishful sight. --Shak. [1913 Webster]
3. Desirable; exciting wishes. [R.] --Chapman. [1913 Webster] -- {Wish"ful*ly}, adv. -- {Wish"ful*ness}, n. [1913 Webster]
wishful adj : seeking advancement or recognition [syn: {aspirant}, {aspiring(p)}, {would-be(a)}]
